title: Second page for curated A-words list with navigation from alphabet grid

requirements.summary: Add a dedicated “A words” view and wire navigation from the existing A–Z alphabet page with a clear way to return.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a second page (separate view) dedicated to “A” words.
From the main alphabet page, there is a clear navigation control (e.g., button/link) to open the “A words” page.
The “A words” page includes a visible page title (e.g., “Words that start with A”) and renders a list of A-related words in a clean, responsive layout.
The “A words” page includes an obvious way to return to the main A–Z page (e.g., Back link/button).

file_operations.description: Create the A-words page component that renders a responsive list layout and includes a prominent page title and a Back control to return to the A–Z view. Use shadcn-ui (e.g., Card) where appropriate for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add lightweight view switching (e.g., local state) to conditionally render either the existing A–Z page content or the new AWordsPage, and pass navigation callbacks between them (open A words, go back).

Wire a clear navigation control from the alphabet grid to the A-words page (e.g., make the “A” tile interactive and/or add an explicit link/button near the grid). Keep other letters non-navigating per non-goals. Use shadcn-ui Card already present for the tile styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Populate the A-words page with a static curated list of at least 25 English words starting with “A”, with no network requests.
acceptanceCriteria: The words displayed on the “A words” page are all English words that begin with “A”.
The list contains enough entries to demonstrate scrolling on smaller screens (at least 25 words).
No network requests are required to display the list.

file_operations.description: Add a static exported curated array of at least 25 English words that start with “A” (no fetching, no backend calls).

Import and render the static A-words list from frontend/src/data/aWords.ts, ensuring the list is scroll-friendly on smaller screens and uses a clean responsive layout. Use shadcn-ui components only via existing library imports where helpful; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
